title: Poha
steps: Wash poha and drain water, keep aside.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and peanuts.
Add onion and green chilies, sauté until onions soften.
Mix in turmeric and washed poha.
Add salt, mix well, and cook for 2–3 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and lemon juice before serving.

title: Misal Pav
steps: Cook sprouted moth beans until soft.
Heat oil and sauté onion, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes.
Add misal masala and cook the gravy.
Mix boiled sprouts with masala and simmer.
Serve in a bowl topped with farsan, onion, coriander, and lemon.
Eat with pav.

title: Mutton Rassa
steps: Marinate mutton with turmeric, chili powder, and ginger-garlic paste.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add roasted coconut and grind into paste.
Cook mutton with onion-tomato masala until it releases oil.
Add Kolhapuri masala and ground paste, cook well.
Pour water, cover, and cook until mutton is tender.
Serve hot with bhakri or rice.

title: Puran Poli
steps: Soak and cook chana dal until soft.
Drain water and mix dal with grated jaggery.
Cook mixture until it thickens into a filling (puran).
Knead wheat flour with water and oil to make dough.
Roll dough, stuff with puran, and flatten into poli.
Cook on tawa with ghee until golden brown.

title: Ukdiche Modak
steps: Heat jaggery and coconut together, cook until filling is ready.
Add cardamom powder and keep aside.
Boil water with ghee and a pinch of salt.
Add rice flour, stir, and cook to form soft dough.
Take small portion of dough, shape into cup, and stuff with filling.
Seal edges and shape into modak.
Steam modaks for 10–12 minutes and serve hot.
